description: API schema for the ThinkAlike platform, with a focus on data transparency, user control, and ethical AI integration. This file serves as a starting point and should be replaced with a complete OpenAPI specification as the API develops.

endpoints.description: Retrieves a list of users. Supports pagination and searching.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term (matches username, email, or full name).

200.description: Successful response - returns an array of user objects.

profile_picture_url.description: URL of the user's profile picture (optional).

created_at.description: Date and time the user account was created.

is_active.description: Indicates if the user account is active.

bio.example: Software developer passionate about ethical AI.

profile_visibility.description: Who can view the user's profile.

security.dataHandling: All user data is handled according to ThinkAlike's ethical guidelines and privacy policy.

testingWorkflow.dataFlowValidation: UI parameters to track data flow during a test: Data is sent to the /users endpoint via a GET request. Response data is displayed in a Data Table component. Users can inspect the raw JSON response. Search and pagination parameters can be adjusted via UI controls.
testingWorkflow.codeValidation: UI components show the code being executed:  A button triggers the API call. Console logs show the request and response. A code editor component displays the relevant backend code (e.g., the route handler in `main.py`).
testingWorkflow.performanceValidation: UI components track system performance: Response time is measured and displayed. Data table rendering time is measured. A graph shows response times over time.
testingWorkflow.ethicalValidation: UI parameters to check ethical code workflow: A checkbox confirms that data minimization principles are followed. A tooltip explains the data encryption methods. Users can adjust pagination settings to test data loading performance.

201.description: User successfully created. Returns the new user's ID.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid input data (e.g., username already exists, email format invalid, password too short).

security.dataHandling: User data is handled according to ThinkAlike's ethical guidelines and privacy policy. Passwords are never stored in plain text.

testingWorkflow.dataFlowValidation: UI parameters to track data flow during registration: Input fields for username, email, password, and optional full name. Data is sent to the /users endpoint via a POST request. A success message or error messages are displayed.
testingWorkflow.codeValidation: UI components show the code being executed: A button triggers the API call. Console logs show the request and response. A code editor component displays the relevant backend code (e.g., the route handler in `main.py`).
testingWorkflow.performanceValidation: UI components to track system performance: Response time is measured and displayed. Form validation performance is measured.
testingWorkflow.ethicalValidation: UI parameters to check ethical code workflow: Checkboxes confirm agreement with terms of service and privacy policy. Tooltips explain password hashing. Error messages clearly explain validation failures.

testingWorkflow.codeValidation: UI components to see and also to track what code is being executed.
testingWorkflow.performanceValidation: UI components to track system performance, response time, data loading times and also, security validation data.
